{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3556732,"name":"Muaz","username":"mtareen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mtareen/{size}/268933_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T02:41:59.662Z","cooked":"

It’s that time! 3 more work days until load in and we need autos!!! We currently have one standard 3 coral on the close side, but we obviously need more. What autos does your team have available?

8 L4 far side

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T04:35:22.576Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":529,"readers_count":528,"score":475.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":24}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60372,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2471 Software co-lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/2","custom_user_title":"2471 Software co-lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":22},{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":29,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556877,"name":"Paulo Khayat","username":"paulokhayat","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/b3f665/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-14T12:21:14.179Z","cooked":"

We like to have one L4 coral from the center, in case our side autos arent performing as well as our allies.

Some teams have been finding qual success with a push one robot off the starting line, then score one coral L4.
Useful for games that are in your favor but you’ll otherwise not get the auto RP.

Worth considering if its worth the effort based on the type of games you’re expecting

Here’s a graphic of our current autos, we also have 3 coral autos for each side as well as the 4 coral autos that are displayed in the picture. The back side auto currently only scores preload and descores an algae, we plan on adding onto that routine but we doubt that we will ever have to use it.

Watch that center auto, it looks like it backs up to the auto line? If you leave the auto line but return to it then you do not get credit for auto movement.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-14T13:02:32.093Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":396,"readers_count":395,"score":174.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62102,"username":"Shlok-6369","name":"Shlok","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shlok-6369/{size}/267421_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557398,"name":"Shlok","username":"Shlok-6369","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shlok-6369/{size}/267421_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T01:08:22.486Z","cooked":"

The center auto is a preload score and descore algae, it stops right before the start line, we need to back up in order to descore our algae due to our mechanism. Thank you for this feedback though, for good measure I’ll put in a new path that moves forward again.

We are also likely never going to use this routine, so it wasn’t developed with a lot of time put into it.

How do you plan to get the robot in the correct starting position pre-match?

We have a fully variable auto cycle, but that isn’t really helpful so, the main autos we ran were ones that went to the side closest to the station and the side that’s closest to the drivers.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T01:39:27.680Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":280,"readers_count":279,"score":56.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/8","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557452,"name":"Shlok","username":"Shlok-6369","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shlok-6369/{size}/267421_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T02:53:53.403Z","cooked":"

for the side autos we use our feet to put the robot roughly 6 feet (like we put 6 footsteps) away from each field wall and our bumpers have to be on the edge of the auto start line, it doesnt have to be exact at all because we use limelight megatag seeding so it gets the robots start pos during disabled and as soon as auto begins it adjusts automatically to the path using april tags, so we’re constantly localized on field at all times. this way we roughly get into the starting position that we want to be in and limelight seeding does the rest.

back auto (descore auto, like the middle of the field) is just in front of that reef roughly.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T03:18:15.585Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":45.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51921,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3100 alum (old prog lead)"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/11","custom_user_title":"3100 alum (old prog lead)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3557463,"name":"ary (xe/they)","username":"rincrossapplesauce","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rincrossapplesauce/{size}/189574_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-15T03:19:18.295Z","cooked":"

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-15T03:19:18.295Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"ary (xe/they)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2872(A) HP / thoughts are my own / i ask too many questions"},"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/12","custom_user_title":"2872(A) HP / thoughts are my own / i ask too many questions","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561242,"name":"Ertu","username":"FRC_Member_apex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T23:09:11.849Z","cooked":"

How do you make it so that the pathplanner knows your exact location on the field or do you have to manually measure and place your robot in the field?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T23:09:11.849Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495530,"topic_slug":"what-are-your-autos","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62102,"username":"Shlok-6369","name":"Shlok","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shlok-6369/{size}/267421_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-are-your-autos/495530/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561307,"name":"Shlok","username":"Shlok-6369","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shlok-6369/{size}/267421_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T00:26:51.717Z","cooked":"

We place the robot in a general starting position and it doesn’t have to be super accurate but its good if it’s within ~1ft of the defined starting spot in pathplanner, then we created a “autoDisabledPeriodic” and called it in disabledPeriodic, where we use Megatag1 to get robot rotation and pos on field from limelights, essentially “seeding” the robot to it’s pos on the field, and then on enable and for the rest of auto/teleop, we switch to Megatag2. This way, we never have to be precise when placing robot on field at start of a match, and Megatag1 seeding does the magic for us as long as both limelights see an apriltag each.

my team has 3.5 piece autos for the left and right sides, as well as a 1 piece with algae removal in the middle. we generate our paths with our own classes for Linear, Quadratic, and Cubic Beziers, we generate our paths based on set positions in our code that we use for pose estimation based auto align in teleop. this way, for example our left and right autos are identical but just flipped over the y axis, which keeps all our autos consistent.
